publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8188 Sandra White: Glasgow’s Mojo Wins the MOBO—That the Parliament welcomes the announcement that the MOBO awards will return to Glasgow in 2011 as part of a three-year deal that will see the awards return to Glasgow in 2013 and 2015 also; considers that Glasgow made history in 2009 by being the first city outside London to hold the MOBO awards in what was widely considered to be one of the best award ceremonies; believes that this ringing endorsement is further evidence of Glasgow’s international appeal, vibrancy and cultural diversity, and congratulates all those at Glasgow City Marketing Bureau and EventScotland on their success.

S3M-8188 Glasgow’s Mojo Wins the MOBO (lodged on 16 March 2011) Jamie Hepburn*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Aileen Campbell*, Bill Kidd*, Stuart McMillan*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Kenneth Gibson*, Gil Paterson*

S3M-8188 Sandra White: Glasgow’s Mojo Wins the MOBO—That the Parliament welcomes the announcement that the MOBO awards will return to Glasgow in 2011 as part of a three-year deal that will see the awards return to Glasgow in 2013 and 2015 also; considers that Glasgow made history in 2009 by being the first city outside London to hold the MOBO awards in what was widely considered to be one of the best award ceremonies; believes that this ringing endorsement is further evidence of Glasgow’s international appeal, vibrancy and cultural diversity, and congratulates all those at Glasgow City Marketing Bureau and EventScotland on their success. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Joe FitzPatrick, Aileen Campbell, Bill Kidd, Stuart McMillan, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Kenneth Gibson, Gil Paterson, Maureen Watt*

S3M-8188 Sandra White: Glasgow’s Mojo Wins the MOBO—That the Parliament welcomes the announcement that the MOBO awards will return to Glasgow in 2011 as part of a three-year deal that will see the awards return to Glasgow in 2013 and 2015 also; considers that Glasgow made history in 2009 by being the first city outside London to hold the MOBO awards in what was widely considered to be one of the best award ceremonies; believes that this ringing endorsement is further evidence of Glasgow’s international appeal, vibrancy and cultural diversity, and congratulates all those at Glasgow City Marketing Bureau and EventScotland on their success. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Joe FitzPatrick, Aileen Campbell, Bill Kidd, Stuart McMillan, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Kenneth Gibson, Gil Paterson, Maureen Watt
